title: Education Centres of Australia delays IPO to 2020
text:
International student services business Education Centres of Australia has postponed plans for an initial public offering and listing on the Australian Securities Exchange.

It is understood ECA founder and owner Rupesh Singh and his advisers pulled preparations this week and instead plan to make a fresh charge next year.

The decision comes as ECA has a handful of potential university partnership deals in the pipeline, including in Australia and India. It is expected to seek to lock in those partnerships before fronting listed equities investors.

Education Centres of Australia had Bank of America and Macquarie Capital preparing it for the ASX-boards. Andrew Quilty

Of course it also comes as IPO markets in Australia and offshore have softened considerably.

Contenders including Latitude Financial Group, PropertyGuru and MPC Kinetic have pulled floats in Australia, falling over at the final huurdle. Others such as Retail Zoo have cut short investor marketing programs and put their mooted deals on ice.
description: International student services business Education Centres of Australia has postponed plans for an initial public offering and listing on the Australian Securities Exchange.
